content.description: The boulder the farthest right. Start with your right hand on the good side pull and left hand in the crack. Move your right hand up to the good pinch and use your left hand for the slopey side pulls in the crack. Top out where the rocks seem to get loose.

Its the super obvious crack in between Jerry's Boulder and Hidden Middle. You accend inside the crack and inch your way to the top. A shirt is recommended to prevent your nipples from rubbing off. Super uncomfortable and closterphobic.

Sit start as for Jerry’s Boulder. Trend left and pass through a few strong moves leading to a big left hand pinch. With a high left foot, shoot out to the triangle hold and finish it like Jerry would.

Start low with your left hand on the huge protruding hold and right hand on the undercling. Traverse right 5ft and then make a huge move to a decent hold. Situate your feet and throw left to the high jug and then top out.
Stand Start to Jerry's Boulder. Start just before the dyno to the decent hold, skipping out on the low traverse. Follow the line from Jerry's boulder sit.

Sit-start on the far left, just above the left-most boulder in the dirt, left of Jerry's Boulder (V1-). The route starts off spicy with some tension-y bumps and throws upward into better clings and crimps. Once you're up, you're advancing right into the cave. It's not a horrible idea to place a chalk bag in the cave, as this is a fantastic location for a quick break. Continue right through the Hidden Middle (V0) problem's start. Once you reach the crack between the middle boulder and Devil's Dick (V2-), you get another break; if you're about 2-3' off the ground you can jam and stand without hands. The finish is on the large pinch on the right-most boulder about 6' up.

It only feels like a V3 because of its length. Otherwise, the moves are fairly straightforward; it's battling the pump that gives it its difficulty

Pumpy & Addicting
content.protection: Best locations for a pad are at the start and just under the finish.
content.location: Sit start two obvious underclings on the left-most boulder. Avoid going higher than 8-9' at any given point.

content.description: Super easy beginner route with big holds. Some of the rocks might be loose
